com.spartanlaboratories.engine.util

Class Location

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.spartanlaboratories.engine.util.Measurement<Location>
      • com.spartanlaboratories.engine.util.Location
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SpawnPoint

    public class Location
extends Measurement<Location>
    Stores a Point with the coordinates (x,y) which will most often designate an object's location in the world. Has a variety of methods of modifying those coordinates as well as converting them to represent an object's location on screen and visa versa.
    Author:
    Spartak

    • Constructor Detail

      • Location

        public Location(double setX,
                double setY)
        Creates a location with the given coordinates. Meant to be used when creating a new Location at a specific point. When changing the location of an already existing point use setCoords(double, double), or change(double, double)
        Parameters:
        setX - the new value of the horizontal coordinate
        setY - the new value of the vertical coordinate
        See Also:
        Location(), Location(Location), Location(Location, StandardCamera)

      • Location

        public Location(Location location)
        Creates a new Location which copies the coordinates of the given location. This does NOT make this location reference the parameter,
        Parameters:
        location - the location whose coordinates will be copied
        See Also:
        Location(), Location(double, double), Location(Location, StandardCamera)

      • Location

        public Location(Location locationOnScreen,
                StandardCamera camera)
        Creates a location at the given point on the screen as seem by the given camera. The Location will be created as a "real" location and not an on-screen one.
        Parameters:
        locationOnScreen - the location whose coordinates will be converted to "real" coordinates
        camera - the camera that is viewing the location
        See Also:
        Location(), Location(double, double), Location(Location)

      • Location

        public Location()
        Creates a Location with the coordinates (0,0)
        See Also:
        Location(Location), Location(double, double), Location(Location, StandardCamera)

      • changeX

        public void changeX(double xChange)
        Changes the x coordinate by the given value. Does what changeY(double) does for the the y coordinate
        Parameters:
        xChange - the net change of the x coordinate
        See Also:
        change(Location)

        Parameters:

      • change

        public void change(Location locChange)
        Changes the coordinates of this location by the values stored in the location given as a parameter. This will not set this location equal no the paramater nor will it link their references.
        Parameters:
        locChange - the location by the coordinates of which this locations coordinates will be modified
        See Also:
        change(double, double)

      • change

        public void change(double changeInX,
                   double changeInY)
        Changes the coordinates of this location by the specified amounts
        Parameters:
        changeInX - the net amount by which the x coordinate will be changed
        changeInY - the net amount by which the y coordinate will be changed

      • getScreenCoords

        public Location getScreenCoords(StandardCamera camera)
        Deprecated. 
        Returns at what point on the screen this location will be at as seen by the given StandardCamera
        Parameters:
        camera - the camera that will be viewing this location
        Returns:
        this location's coordinates on a screen stored in a new location

      • getLocationInWorld

        public static Location getLocationInWorld(Location locationOnScreen,
                                          StandardCamera camera)
        Deprecated. 
        Returns a Location the coordinates of which are "real world" coordinates which correspond to the screen coordinates passed in.
        Parameters:
        locationOnScreen - The location on screen whose coordinates are being converted to real world coordinates.
        camera - The camera that is viewing the location on screen.
        Returns:
        a new Location with real world coordinates

      • setFromScreen

        public void setFromScreen(Location locationOnScreen,
                          StandardCamera camera)
        Sets the coordinates of this location to be what the coordinates of the passed location are in the "real" world. For example if a location on screen is passed in with the coordinates (x1,y1) then first of all based on the camera the passed in location's coordinates will be converted to their "real" values which are say (x2,y2) and then this location's coordinates will be set to (x2, y2).
        Parameters:
        locationOnScreen - the location on a screen whose "real" world coordinates will be assigned to this location
        camera - the camera that is viewing the passed location on screen
        See Also:
        Location(Location, StandardCamera), getLocationInWorld(Location, StandardCamera)

      • revert

        public void revert(Location previousChange)
        Changes the coordinates of the current location by the negatives of the coordinates of the passed in location. For example if the passed in location has the coordinates (x1,y1) this function is equivalent of calling change(-x1,-y1)
        Parameters:
        previousChange - the location by the opposite of which this location is being changed

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the coordinate values of this location formatted into a string. The coordinate values will only contain two digits after the decimal point.

        Example: if the coordinate values of this location happen to be 5.286 and 7.291 then this method will return:
        "(5.28,7.29)"

        Specified by:
        toString in class Measurement<Location>
        Returns:
        - The string value of this Location

        Prints the toString() value of this location to standard output.

        Prints the toString() value of this location to the passed in console.
        Parameters:
        console - - The console that will be displaying this location

        Swaps the x and y values of this location.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        false otherwise

      • clear

        Sets each coordinate value of this location to 0.

      • copyTo

        public void copyTo(Location element)
        Makes the coordinate values of the passed in location match those of this location.
        Specified by:
        copyTo in class Measurement<Location>
        Parameters:
        element - - The location the coordinates of which are going to match those of this location.

      • magnify

        public void magnify(double d)
        Multiplies the value of each coordinate by the given amount and sets the product as the new coordinate value. For example if the values of this location's coordinates were (2,3) and this function was called with an argument of 3 like so: magnify(3) then the new coordinates of this location would be (6,9).
        Parameters:
        d - - the value by which the coordinates of this location are being magnified.

      • isGreaterThan

        public boolean isGreaterThan(Location comparedLocation)
        Checks and returns whether or not each of this location's coordinates is greater than the coordinates of the specified location.
        Parameters:
        comparedLocation - - The location to which this location's coordinates are being compared to.
        Returns:
        true if both the x and the y coordinates of this location are greater than those of the specified location.
        false if either of the coordinates are not greater than those of the specified location.

      • isGreaterThanOrEqualTo

        public boolean isGreaterThanOrEqualTo(Location comparedLocation)
        Checks and returns whether or not each of this location's coordinates is greater than or equal to the coordinates of the specified location.
        Parameters:
        comparedLocation - - The location to which this location's coordinates are being compared to.
        Returns:
        true if both the x and the y coordinates of this location are greater than or equal to those of the specified location.
        false if either of the coordinates are not greater than or equal to those of the specified location.

      • isLessThan

        public boolean isLessThan(Location comparedLocation)
        Checks and returns whether or not each of this location's coordinates is less than the coordinates of the specified location.
        Parameters:
        comparedLocation - - The location to which this location's coordinates are being compared to.
        Returns:
        true if both the x and the y coordinates of this location are less than those of the specified location.
        false if either of the coordinates are not less than those of the specified location.

      • isLessThanOrEqualTo

        public boolean isLessThanOrEqualTo(Location comparedLocation)
        Checks and returns whether or not each of this location's coordinates is less than or equal to the coordinates of the specified location.
        Parameters:
        comparedLocation - - The location to which this location's coordinates are being compared to.
        Returns:
        true if both the x and the y coordinates of this location less than or equal to those of the specified location.
        false if either of the coordinates are not less than or equal to those of the specified location.

      • negate

        public void negate()
        Sets both of the coordinates of this location to their opposite. (Effectively multiplies each by -1). For example if a location had the coordinates (5.193, -132.2) then calling this function would change those coordinates to (-5.193, 132.2)

      • getOpposite

        public Location getOpposite()
